statement:
Let the complex function $f(z)$ be holomorphic in a deleted
neighbourhood of the point $z = z_0$ of the closed complex plane
$\mathbb{C}\cup\{\infty\}$. This point is

-   a regular point (or a removable singularity) iff $f(z)$ is bounded
    in a neighbourhood of $z_0$,

-   a pole iff $\displaystyle\lim_{z \to z_0}|f(z)| \,=\, +\infty$,

-   an essential singularity iff there is neither of the above cases.
